original: Forssell, Carl Fredrik Jakob, fil. dr, civilingenjÖT, GöfeboTg, f. 6/4/77 i Asp e bo da, Kopparb. 1., av in t. Abraham F. o. Maria Trahn. G. 04 m. Augusta Gottlieb. translated: Forssell, Carl Fredrik Jakob, PhD, MSc in Engineering, from Göteborg, born on April 6th, 1877, in Asp e bo da, Kopparberg County, son of Abraham F. and Maria Trahn. Married in 1904 to Augusta Gottlieb, with children Harry (born 1908), Sigvard (born 1910), Nina (born 1914), and Ruth (born 1919). He attended Norra real in Stockholm in 1895 and studied at KTH (E) from 1896 to 1899, and at Stockholm University and the University of Giessen from 1899 to 1902, where he earned a PhD. He worked as an assistant at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology in Boston from 1902 to 1903, an engineer at National Carbon Co. in Cleveland from 1903 to 1908, a works engineer at Höganäs-Billesholmia A-B from 1908 to 1910, and as managing director for A-B Kolm from 1910 to 1915. He worked as a consultant engineer from 1915 to 1917, and founded and served as managing director for Skand. Grafitind. A-B from 1917 to 1947. He served as chairman of the board at Skand. Grafitind. A-B, as well as the electrochemical employers' association Tro’Hh from 1920 to 1947. He also served as honorary chairman for the Tro’1’l’h sharpshooting association, and was a member of the national shooting association's steering committee. He was the chairman of the board for Västg.-Dals' shooting association, a city council member from 1920 to 1926, chairman of the fire brigade from 1920 to 1928, and a substitute member of the city council from 1931 to 1938. He undertook multiple study and business trips as a consultant engineer, both domestically and abroad, including to the UK and USA. He has publications on heat technology, chemistry, and electrochemistry in various industry publications, both in Sweden and internationally, and has received several awards and honors, including a Royal Medal of the 8th size, Knight of the Order of Vasa, Patent Examiner, Shooting Awards, and the Honorary Livelihood Award.

structured.name: Carl Fredrik Jakob Forssell

structured.description: Swedish scholar and engineer known for his work in heat technology, chemistry, and electrochemistry.
